name: ui-table handler
info:
# ui-table handler
Universal handler for ui-table.
## features
- buffer table data
- add or update individual rows or cells of the table
- delete rows
- clear tableData
- handle column width
- handle column order
- hide und unhide columns
- hide and unhide rows
- records row order
- support for nested columns [(column groups)](http://tabulator.info/examples/4.7#column-groups)
- support for child rows (_children) [(nested data trees)](http://tabulator.info/examples/4.7#tree)

For real life example see:

**syslog server** for logfile like table with filters

**remote device table** for dynamically updated table with context menues

**irrigation system** for sortable rows

## sending data to ui-tabel

- sending an `array` as discribed in ui-table will replace the complete table and delete all table edits
  
  if `msg.keepEdits=true` is added the existing edits will be kept.
- send an `object` containing the updated properties of a table row by sending msg.<tableDataProp>.

  The table is updated using the `updateOrAddData` command. You can alter the command used by adding the `msg.tabulatorCommand` and `msg.tabulatorParameter`

```
msg.tabulatorCommand="addData";
msg.tabulatorParameter=[true];
```
## configuration
- `tabulator` json formatted object containing configuration of the table. See ui-table for more details.
- `property` property of the msg object that contains the data to be passed to ui-table. I.e. *state* `msg.state`
- `index` index column to identify individual rows. Each message containing data must have a unique `msg.topic` to identify the row. Messages without this `msg.topic` will be droped. It is not nessesary but possible to display the index column in the table. Do not enable editing on this column otherwise you will loose the connection and another row will be added to the table as soon as a new message arrives!

   Defaults to *$topic* `msg.state.$topic`
- `maxRows`maximum number of rows held by table widget. If grater than **0** the amount of rows in ui-table is limited. For this to work the index row must be a Number. ´rows < currentID-maxRows´ will be deleted.
- `maxStore`maximum number of rows stored by this node for replay if a client connects. If grater than **0** the amount of rows in flow context is limited. for this to work the index row must be a Number. ´rows < currentID-maxStore´ will be deleted.
- `dashboard` name of the dashboard tab to only update the table if the dashboard is visible. If empty the table will be updated on every tab change and connect.
- `context` configuration of context data. The subflow will save or cache data in the flows context using `$parent.`. 
   **tableData** caches the incoming data to restore it on `ui-control´ *change* messages.
   **tableConfig** saves column width and order to save the interactive table layot
   **tableEdit** saves edits on the table data otherwise it would be overwritten when new data arrives
```json
{
    "tableData": {
        "name": "tableData"
    },
    "tableConfig": {
        "name": "tableConfig",
        "storage": "file"
    },
    "tableEdit": {
        "name": "tableEdit",
        "storage": "file"
    }
}
```

## commands
commands can be passed by sending a object as `msg.payload`

```json
{
    "command": "delete",
    "object": "columnOrder"
}
```

- `deleteTable` tableCache
- `deleteRow` delete single row. `object` matching index property
- `ignoreRow` delete single row and put it on an ignore list. `object` matching index property
- `unIgnoreRow`remove row from the ignore list.  `object` matching index property
- `unIgnoreRows`delte the ignore list. 
- `deleteRowOrder` delete custom row order
- `deleteColumnOrder` delete custom column order
  This is important if you add or delete columns in the tabulator config otherwise the columns most likely don`t show up
- `deleteColumnWidth` delete custom column width
- `columnHide` hide a column. `object` matching column field
- `columnUnHide` unhide a column. `object` matching column field
- `columnsUnHide` unhide all hidden columns.
- `setMaxStore` set maximum amount of rows in cache
- `setMaxDisplay` set maximum amout of rows in ui-table
- `getTable` get table data (as displayed) as an array (on 2nd output)
 
## background
ui-table warps the powerfull tabluator library.  This subflow makes it easier to unleash the powerfull features of ui-table

env.name: tabulator
env.value: {"tabulator":{"responsiveLayout":"collapse","responsiveLayoutCollapseStartOpen":false,"index":"$name","layout":"fitColumns","movableColumns":true,"groupBy":"","columnResized":"function(column){ var newColumn = { field: column._column.field, visible: column._column.visible, width: column._column.width, widthFixed: column._column.widthFixed, widthStyled: column._column.widthStyled }; this.send({topic:this.config.topic,ui_control:{callback:'columnResized',columnWidths:newColumn}}); }","columnMoved":"function(column, columns){ var newColumns=[]; columns.forEach(function (column) { newColumns.push({'field': column._column.definition.field, 'title': column._column.definition.title}); }); this.send({topic:this.config.topic,ui_control:{callback:'columnMoved',columns:newColumns}}); }","rowFormatter":"function(row){ var data = row.getData(); switch (data.$state) { case \"lost\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"#9e2e66\"; row.getElement().style.color = \"#a6a6a6\"; break; case \"sleeping\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"#336699\"; break; case \"disconnected\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"#cc3300\"; row.getElement().style.color = \"#a6a6a6\"; break; case \"alert\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"#A6A6DF\"; break; case \"init\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"#f2f20d\"; break; case \"ready\": row.getElement().style.backgroundColor = \"\"; row.getElement().style.color = \"\"; break; } }","columns":[{"formatter":"responsiveCollapse","width":30,"minWidth":30,"align":"center","resizable":false,"headerSort":false,"frozen":true,"title":"expand","field":"expand","headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatter":"function(cell, formatterParams, onRendered) { var html = cell.getValue(); return html; }","title":"State","field":"$stateIcon","width":100,"frozen":true,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatter":"function(cell, formatterParams, onRendered) { var html = cell.getValue(); return html; }","title":"Signal","field":"signalIcon","width":100,"frozen":true,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"Name","field":"$name","width":100,"frozen":true,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"State","field":"$state","width":100,"align":"center","headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"last-ready","field":"lastSeenreadyFormatted","width":100,"align":"left","headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"Homie","field":"$homie","width":100,"align":"left","headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"Platform","field":"$implementation","width":100,"align":"left","headerVertical":"flip"},{"title":"Statistics","columns":[{"title":"Interval","field":"interval","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"outputFormat":"d hh:mm:ss","inputFormat":"seconds","invalidPlaceholder":"(unknown)"},"title":"Uptime","field":"uptime","formatter":"function(cell, formatterParams, onRendered){ var pad = function (num) { return (\"0\"+num).slice(-2); }; var secs = Number(cell.getValue()); if (Number.isNaN(secs)) return; var minutes = Math.floor(secs / 60); secs = secs%60; var hours = Math.floor(minutes/60); minutes = minutes%60; var days = Math.floor(hours/24); hours = hours%24; if (days>0) return days+\"d \"+pad(hours)+\":\"+pad(minutes); else return pad(hours)+\":\"+pad(minutes)+\":\"+pad(secs); }","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100,"color":["red","orange","green"],"legend":"function (value) {if (value>0) return \"\"+value+\" %\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#FFFFFF","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"Signal","field":"signal","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"min":2.5,"max":3.5,"color":["red","green","red"],"legend":"function (value) { if (value>0) return \"\"+value+\" V\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#101010","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"Supply","field":"supply","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100,"color":["red","orange","green"],"legend":"function (value) { if (value>0) return \"\"+value+\" %\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#101010","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"Battery","field":"battery","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100000,"color":["red","orange","green"],"legend":"function (value) { if (value>0) return \"\"+(value/1024).toFixed(2)+\" kB\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#101010","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"Memory","field":"freeheap","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"target":"_blank","min":0,"max":100,"color":["red","orange","green"],"legend":"function (value) { if (value>0) return \"\"+value+\" %\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#101010","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"CPU load","field":"cpuload","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"},{"formatterParams":{"min":20,"max":60,"color":["green","orange","red"],"legend":"function (value) { if (value>0) return \"\"+value+\" °C\"; else return; }","legendColor":"#101010","legendAlign":"center"},"title":"CPU temp","field":"cputemp","formatter":"progress","width":100,"headerVertical":"flip"}]},{"title":"Firmware","columns":[{"formatter":"link","formatterParams":{"labelField":"$localip","urlPrefix":"http://","target":"_blank"},"title":"IP","field":"$localip","width":100},{"title":"mac","field":"$mac","width":100},{"title":"Accsess Point","field":"SSID","width":100},{"title":"Firmware","field":"name","width":100},{"title":"Version","field":"version","width":100},{"title":"Last Boot Cause","field":"lastBootCause","width":100},{"title":"Reset Reason","field":"resetReason","width":100}]}]},"customHeight":12}

name: Solar forecast
info:
This subflow uses the http request node to fetch solar forecasts for geographical positions, using the API from https://forecast.solar/. Please check their website and consider getting a paid account.

Do note that, on a free account, you are limited in the number of requests to do. Also note that the data only gets updated once every 15 minutes, so there is no reason to query more often. There is rate limiting built in the subflow not to perform requests more than once every 15 minutes.

# Configuration

It uses the parameters as described on: http://doc.forecast.solar/doku.php

 - `:apikey` - personal API key for registered users
 - `:lat` - latitude of location, -90 (south) … 90 (north); Internal precission is 0.0001 or abt. 10 m
 - `:lon` - longitude of location, -180 (west) … 180 (east); Internal precission is 0.0001 or abt. 10 m
 - `:dec` - plane declination, 0 (horizontal) … 90 (vertical); Internal precission is integer
 - `:az` - plane azimuth, -180 … 180 (-180 = north, -90 = east, 0 = south, 90 = west, 180 = north); Internal precission is integer
 - `:kwp` - installed modules power in kilo watt peak (kWp)

You can choose between 3 different type of requests. Note that only `estimate` is available on the free plan.

- `estimate` - this is the forecasted estimate that your panels should produce (given the right parameter settings)
- `history` - historycal data
- `clear sky` - estimate given if there would be a clear sky tomorrow

In case of estimates, one of the following options can be selected:
- `watts` - Watts (power) average for the period
- `watt_hours_period` - Watt hours (energy) for the period
- `watt_hours` - Watt hours (energy) summarized over the day
- `watt_hours_day` - Watt hours (energy) summarized for each day

For the graph output there are some extra settings available:

- _Output in kWh_ - when checked output can be set to kWh instead of Wh
- _Show todays forecast_ - whether or not to include todays forecast
- _Days to forecast_ - the number of days to forecast (excluding today). Note that you can not get more days forecasted than your API key allows.
- _Widen graph_ - widen the graph to only show non-zero values
- _Show day instead of date_ - Show the day instead of the date in the series and labels

# Input 

The input is for triggering the solar forecast request. 
It triggers when injecting a message into the node.

# Output

There are two outputs. The first output is an object with the result and a status message stored into the `msg.payload`.

Most important is the `msg.payload.result`, which contains the estimated production of the panels. E.g.:

```
payload: object
  result: object
    2022-11-28: 23
    2022-11-29: 35
```

The `msg.payload.message` gives information on how successful the query was, the exitcode of the query and the status of the rate limit (how many queries you have left).

The **second** output can be directly linked to a line or a bar chart, quickly giving a once-glance overview for the predicted forecast.

# Status

Initially the status of the note will be a blue dot, showing "_Unknown limit_", as it is unaware of the set ratelmits. After the first request, the returned ratelimit will be put in the text in the form of `remaining/limit`. If more than half the limit is remaining, the dot will be green. If less then half the limit is remaining, the dot will be yellow. If no limit is left, the dot will turn red.
Please keep in mind that the ratelimit will be reset after one hour, so you can send a new request after that hour.

If something is wrong in the API request, the dot will turn red
and the message will contain the msg.payload with the error. This
happens typically when the API is temporally down for maintenance.

l.en-US: Watt hours (energy) summarized over the day
Watt hours (energy) summarized for each day

name: Solar forecast (2)
info:
This subflow uses the http request node to fetch solar forecasts for geographical positions, using the API from https://forecast.solar/. Please check their website and consider getting a paid account.

Do note that, on a free account, you are limited in the number of requests to do. Also note that the data only gets updated once every 15 minutes, so there is no reason to query more often. There is rate limiting built in the subflow not to perform requests more than once every 15 minutes.

name: create forecast.solar url
update ratelimit
update status
Create graph output
Set error status
Processed info
info:
Function to process the result from forecast.solar to add
extra information, which is handy for either graphing or
to store in a database.


The extra values added:
- `msg.resolution` - The number of measurements per hour. If
no API key is used, this will be 1. Other values may be 2 or 4.
- `msg.days` - The number of days in the forcast. If no API
- key is used this will be 1. Other values may be 3 or 6.

- key is used this will be 1. Other values may be 3 or 6.

    myRooms[113] = {};
    myRooms[113].knx = "3/4";
    myRooms[113].rect = "rect" + myRooms[113].knx.replace("/", "_");
    myRooms[113].grp = "grpRm1.13";
    myRooms[113].floor = 1;
    
    
    
    window.svg = document.querySelector("#vssSVG");
    window.svgIcon = document.querySelector("#infoIcon");
    window.svgControlIcon = document.querySelector("#controlInfoIcon") ;
    
    window.isLoop = false;
    var counter = 0;
    function loopFunction() 
    {
        if(isLoop)
        {
            switch(counter)
            {
                case 0:
                    if(selectedFloor == 0)
                    {
                        selectFloor(1);
                    }
                    else if(selectedFloor == 1)
                    {
                        selectFloor(0);
                    }
                    clickQuartre("T", true);
                    counter++;
                    break;
                case 1:
                    clickQuartre("H", true);
                    counter++;
                    break;
                case 2:
                    clickQuartre("L", true);
                    counter++;
                    break;
                case 3:
                    clickQuartre("C", true);
                    counter = 0;
                    break;
                default:
                    console.log("error in looping function");
            }
        }
    }
    
    function selectFloor(floor)
    {
        if(floor == 0)
        {
            svg.contentDocument.getElementById("LayerBG").style.display = "flex"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("Layer1e").style.display = "none";
            selectedFloor = 0;
        }
        else if(floor == 1)
        {
            svg.contentDocument.getElementById("LayerBG").style.display = "none"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("Layer1e").style.display = "flex"; 
            selectedFloor = 1;
        }
    }
    function clickFunction(room, event) 
    {
        selectedRoom = room.knx.replace("/", "_");
        svgIcon.style.transform="scale(20%, 20%)";
        svgIcon.style.transform="translate(" + (event.clientX - 110) + "px, " + (event.clientY - 90) + "px)";
        svgIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("ruimteNummer").textContent = "Ruimte " + room.grp.replace("grpRm", "");
    }
    svg.addEventListener
    (   
        "load", function() {
        const intervalId = setInterval(loopFunction, 30000);
        scope = window.globalVar;
        window.preferences = [];
        window.currentColour = [];
        document.getElementById("infoIcon").addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { window.svgIcon.style.transform = window.svgIcon.style.transform + " scale(0.0001%, 0.0001%)" });
        //toggle loop
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("selectLoop").addEventListener("click", function(event) 
        {
            if(isLoop)
            {
                svg.contentDocument.getElementById("rectLoop").style.fill="#b4113d";
            }
            else
            {
                svg.contentDocument.getElementById("rectLoop").style.fill="#eee";
            }
            isLoop = !isLoop;
        });
        window.selectedFloor = 0;
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("LayerBG").style.display = "flex"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("Layer1e").style.display = "none";
        svgControlIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("ruimteNummer").textContent = "Alle ruimtes";
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.display = "none"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.display = "inline"; svgControlIcon.style.display = "none";
        //initialise grey colours
        for(i = 0; i < myRooms.length; i++)
        {
            if(myRooms[i] != undefined)
            {
                currentColour[myRooms[i].knx.replace("/", "_")] = "#eee";     
            }
        }
        
        //open settings
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.transition = "opacity 200ms";
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.transition = "opacity 200ms";
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.display = "inline"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.display = "none"; svgControlIcon.style.display = "inline";});
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").addEventListener("mouseleave", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.display = "none"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.display = "inline"; svgControlIcon.style.display = "none";});
        svgControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.display = "inline"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.display = "none"; svgControlIcon.style.display = "inline";});
        svgControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseleave", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById("expandedControlIcon").style.display = "none"; svg.contentDocument.getElementById("miniatureControlIcon").style.display = "inline"; svgControlIcon.style.display = "none";});
        //selecteer ruimte
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("select1e").addEventListener("click", function(event) { selectFloor(1) } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById("selectBG").addEventListener("click", function(event) { selectFloor(0) } );
        //add click functions
        //begane grond
        svgIcon.style.transform= svgIcon.style.transform + " scale(0.0001%, 0.0001%)"
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[1].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[1] , event); } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[3].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[3], event); } );

        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[12].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[12], event); } );
        
        //1e verdieping
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[101].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[101], event); } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[102].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[102], event); } );

        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[107].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[107], event); } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[111].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[111], event); } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[112].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[112], event); } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[113].grp).addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickFunction(myRooms[113], event); } );
        
        //add mouseout functions
        //begane grond
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[1].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[1].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[1].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[3].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[3].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[3].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[4].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[4].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[4].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[5].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[5].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[5].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[6].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[6].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[6].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[7].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[7].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[7].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[8].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[8].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[8].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[11].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[11].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[11].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[12].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[12].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[12].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        
        //1e verdieping
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[101].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[101].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[101].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[102].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[102].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[102].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[103].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[103].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[103].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[104].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[104].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[104].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[105].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[105].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[105].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[106].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[106].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[106].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[107].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[107].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[107].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[111].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[111].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[111].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[112].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[112].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[112].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
        svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[113].grp).addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { svg.contentDocument.getElementById(myRooms[113].rect).style.fill = currentColour[myRooms[113].knx.replace("/", "_")]; } );
       
        //add event listeners for local control
        tempIcon = svgIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("TempGrp");
        humIcon = svgIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("HumGrp");
        luxIcon = svgIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("LuxGrp");
        CO2Icon = svgIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("CO2Grp");
        
        
        tempIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("T", false); });
        tempIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(-5, -5, "out", tempIcon); });
        tempIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(-5, -5, "in", tempIcon); });
        
        humIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("H", false); });
        humIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(5, -5, "out", humIcon); });
        humIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(5, -5, "in", humIcon); });
        
        luxIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("L", false); });
        luxIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(-5, 5, "out", luxIcon); });
        luxIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(-5, 5, "in", luxIcon); });
        
        CO2Icon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("C", false); });
        CO2Icon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(5, 5, "out", CO2Icon); });
        CO2Icon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(5, 5, "in", CO2Icon); });
        
        // add eventlisteners for main control icon
        
        tempControlIcon = svgControlIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("TempGrp");
        humControlIcon = svgControlIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("HumGrp");
        luxControlIcon = svgControlIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("LuxGrp");
        CO2ControlIcon = svgControlIcon.contentDocument.getElementById("CO2Grp");
        
        tempControlIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("T", true); });
        tempControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(-5, -5, "out", tempControlIcon); });
        tempControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(-5, -5, "in", tempControlIcon); });
        
        humControlIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("H", true); });
        humControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(5, -5, "out", humControlIcon); });
        humControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(5, -5, "in", humControlIcon); });
        
        luxControlIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("L", true); });
        luxControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(-5, 5, "out", luxControlIcon); });
        luxControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(-5, 5, "in", luxControlIcon); });
        
        CO2ControlIcon.addEventListener("click", function(event) { clickQuartre("C", true); });
        CO2ControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseover", function(event) { pop(5, 5, "out", CO2ControlIcon); });
        CO2ControlIcon.addEventListener("mouseout", function(event) { pop(5, 5, "in", CO2ControlIcon); });
    });
    function knxMessage(msg, scope) 
    {
        if(msg.knx != null)
        {
            if(preferences[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] == "T" && msg.Tvalue != undefined)
            {
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("rect" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).style.fill = msg.Tcolour;   
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("valDisplay" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).textContent = msg.Tvalue;
                currentColour[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] = msg.Tcolour;
            }
            else if(preferences[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] == "H" && msg.Hvalue != undefined)
            {
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("rect" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).style.fill = msg.Hcolour;
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("valDisplay" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).textContent = msg.Hvalue;
                currentColour[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] = msg.Hcolour;
            }
            else if(preferences[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] == "L" && msg.Lvalue != undefined)
            {
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("rect" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).style.fill = msg.Lcolour;
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("valDisplay" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).textContent = msg.Lvalue;
                currentColour[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] = msg.Lcolour;
            }
            else if(preferences[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] == "C" && msg.Cvalue != undefined)
            {
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("rect" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).style.fill = msg.Ccolour;
                svg.getSVGDocument().getElementById("valDisplay" + msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)).textContent = msg.Cvalue;
                currentColour[msg.knx.destination.slice(0,3)] = msg.Ccolour;
            }
        }
    }
    (function(scope) 
    {
        window.globalVar = scope;
        scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) 
        {
            if (msg) 
            {
                knxMessage(msg, scope)
            }
        });
    })
    (scope);
})();

function pop(x, y, dir, localSvg) 
{
    if(window.svg != null && localSvg != null)
    {
        currentTransform = new DOMMatrix(window.getComputedStyle(localSvg).getPropertyValue("transform"));
        currentTransform_outline = new DOMMatrix(window.getComputedStyle(localSvg).getPropertyValue("transform"));
        if(dir == "in")
        {
            currentTransform.e -= x;
            currentTransform.f -= y; 
        }
        else if(dir == "out")
        {
            currentTransform.e += x;
            currentTransform.f += y;
        }
        localSvg.setAttribute('transform', currentTransform);
    }
}


function clickQuartre(val, isMainControl)
{
    if(isMainControl)
    {
        for(i = 0; i < myRooms.length; i++)
        {
            if(myRooms[i] != undefined && myRooms[i].floor == selectedFloor)
            {
                preferences[myRooms[i].knx.replace("/", "_")] = val;
                scope.send({payload: myRooms[i].knx, unit: val});
            }
        }
    }
    else
    {
        svgIcon.style.transform= svgIcon.style.transform + " scale(0.0001%, 0.0001%)"
        scope.send({payload: selectedRoom.replace("_", "/"), unit: val});
        preferences[selectedRoom] = val;
    }
}


</script>
<style>

.freeze {
   pointer-events: none;
}
.floorplan
{
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: start;
}
.icon
{
    transition: transform .2s ease-in-out;
    position: absolute;
    width: 20%;
    height: 20%;
    transform-origin: center center;
    opacity: 85%;
}
.control_icon
{
    transition: transform .2s ease-in-out;
    position: absolute;
    top: 675px;
    left: 180px;
    width: 20%;
    height: 20%;
    transform-origin: center center;
    opacity: 85%;
}
</style>
<object data="/infoIcon.svg" type="image/svg+xml" id="controlInfoIcon" class="control_icon"></object>
<object data="/infoIcon.svg" type="image/svg+xml" id="infoIcon" class="icon"></object>
<object data="/vssBG.svg" type="image/svg+xml" id="vssSVG" class="floorplan"></object>

name: TotalEnergy
Voorspelde energieopbrengst
format:
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js"></script>
<canvas id="energyChart" style="width:100%;max-width:600px"></canvas>
<canvas id="energyChart2" style="width:100%;max-width:600px"></canvas>
<script>
var energyChart;
var energyChart2;
refreshGraphs();
const intervalId = setInterval(refreshGraphs, 5000);
function refreshGraphs()
{
    console.log("refreshing graphs");
    loadGraphs();
    updateGraph(JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("lastGraph")));
    updateGraph(JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("lastGraph2")));
    console.log("refreshing graphs complete");
}
(function(scope) 
    {
        scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) 
        {
            if (msg) 
            {
                if(msg.graph == 1)
                {
                    localStorage.setItem('lastGraph', JSON.stringify(msg));
                }
                else if(msg.graph == 2)
                {
                    localStorage.setItem('lastGraph2', JSON.stringify(msg));
                }
                updateGraph(msg);
            }
        });
    })
(scope);
function updateGraph(msg)
{
    if(msg.graph == 1)
    {
        energyChart.options.scales.y.max = msg.y1max;
        energyChart.options.scales.y1.max = msg.y2max;
        energyChart.data.labels = msg.xValues;
        energyChart.data.datasets[0].data = msg.yValues1;
        energyChart.data.datasets[1].data = msg.yValues2;
        energyChart.update();
    }
    else if(msg.graph == 2)
    {
        energyChart2.options.scales.y.max = msg.y1max;
        energyChart2.options.scales.y1.max = msg.y2max;
        energyChart2.data.labels = msg.xValues;
        energyChart2.data.datasets[0].data = msg.yValues1;
        energyChart2.data.datasets[1].data = msg.yValues2;
        energyChart2.update();
    }

}
function loadGraphs()
{
    energyChart = new Chart("energyChart", {
      type: "line",
      data: {
        labels: null,
        datasets: [{
          label: "Energie (kWh)",
          fill: false,
          pointStyle: false,
          backgroundColor: "rgb(0,255,10,1)",
          borderColor: "rgb(0,255,10,1)",
          yAxisID: 'y',
          data: null
        },
        {
          label: "Vermogen (kW)",
          fill: true,
          pointStyle: false,
          backgroundColor: "rgb(0,0,255,0.25)",
          borderColor: "Blue",
          yAxisID: 'y1',
          data: null
        }
        ]
      },
      
      options: {
        legend: {display: true},
        scales: {
          y: {
            type: 'linear',
            display: true,
            position: 'right',
            max: 70,
          },
          y1: {
            type: 'linear',
            display: true,
            position: 'left',
            max: 4,
    
            // grid line settings
            grid: {
              drawOnChartArea: false, // only want the grid lines for one axis to show up
            },
          },
        }
      }
    });
    
    energyChart2 = new Chart("energyChart2", {
      type: "line",
      data: {
        labels: null,
        datasets: [{
          label: "Energie (kWh)",
          fill: false,
          pointStyle: false,
          backgroundColor: "rgb(0,255,10,1)",
          borderColor: "rgb(0,255,10,1)",
          yAxisID: 'y',
          data: null
        },
        {
          label: "Vermogen (kW)",
          fill: true,
          pointStyle: false,
          backgroundColor: "rgb(0,0,255,0.25)",
          borderColor: "Blue",
          yAxisID: 'y1',
          data: null
        }
        ]
      },
      
      options: {
        legend: {display: true},
        scales: {
          y: {
            type: 'linear',
            display: true,
            position: 'right',
            max: 70,
          },
          y1: {
            type: 'linear',
            display: true,
            position: 'left',
            max: 4,
    
            // grid line settings
            grid: {
              drawOnChartArea: false, // only want the grid lines for one axis to show up
            },
          },
        }
      }
    });
    Chart.defaults.color = "#ffffff";
}

</script>
</body>
